At the stumps, full in length, Najmul Hossain Shanto lunges to block.
Full and around off, pushed to short cover.
This keeps low, slower and shorter, on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto keeps it out.
Full and around off, Najmul Hossain Shanto defends it off the front foot.
Full and on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto clips it to mid-wicket.
Short and outside off, cut away to deep point for a single.
This tails back in, on a good length, on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto lunges to defend and ekes out an inside edge onto the front pad.
On a short of a length, on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto hops and pushes it to cover.
Slanting down leg, on a back of a length, Najmul Hossain Shanto misses the tickle.
On a back of a length, on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto stabs it down on the off side.

FOUR! Cracked away! Richard Ngarava looks to bang in a short ball but this sits up to be hit, on middle and leg, Najmul Hossain Shanto swivels nicely and pulls it to the right of deep fine leg for a boundary.
At the hips, Mushfiqur Rahim nudges it to deep fine leg for a single.
FOUR! Pulled away! Short and on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto rocks on the back foot and pulls it towards deep mid-wicket. Beats the diving fielder in the deep to his left for a boundary.
Full and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto defends it off the front foot.
Short and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto pushes it back to the bowler.
Short and on leg, Mushfiqur Rahim nudges it to square leg for one.

FOUR! Hit with authority! Tosses it up, does Wellington Masakadza, on off, Mushfiqur Rahim gets down on a knee and slog sweeps it to the right of mid-wicket for a boundary. The 50-run stand comes up. Bangladesh lead by 20 runs!
Full and on off, Mushfiqur Rahim blocks it out off the front foot.
On a back of a length, on middle and leg, Mushfiqur Rahim turns it in front of square on the leg side for a single.
Nails the yorker, on off, Mushfiqur Rahim squeezes it out on the off side.
On off, on a good length, Mushfiqur Rahim gets behind the line to stab it down.
Full and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto looks to push it down the ground. Gets an inside edge down to deep fine leg for one.
Full and wide on off, Mushfiqur Rahim reaches out and eases the drive to deep point for a single.
Angling back into the right-hander, on a good length, on off, Mushfiqur Rahim taps it beside the pitch on the off side.
Short and on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto jabs it to mid-wicket.
Short and around leg, Mushfiqur Rahim tucks it to deep fine leg for a single.
Tosses it up, full and on off, defended off the front foot.
Short and over off, Mushfiqur Rahim hangs back to defend.
Short and around off, cut away to backward point.
FOUR! Nicely done! Short and around off, Mushfiqur Rahim goes on the back foot and cuts it late to the left of short third for a boundary.
On the pads, on a length, Najmul Hossain Shanto turns it to square leg.
Full and slanting down leg, Najmul Hossain Shanto looks to clip but misses.
Richard Ngarava is really struggling with his lines in this over! Another down leg, Najmul Hossain Shanto lets it through.
Sliding down leg, on the fuller side, Najmul Hossain Shanto lets it pass.
On a good length, on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto blocks it out with a straight bat.
Sprayed down leg, on a short of a length, Najmul Hossain Shanto lets it go.
Full and around off, Mushfiqur Rahim presses forward to defend.
Short on off, Mushfiqur Rahim hangs back and blocks it back to the bowler.

Quick and short, on middle, Mushfiqur Rahim rocks back and punches it through the off side towards deep extra cover. Batters take a single. The fielder from the deep fires in a direct hit and the ball runs away. Batters run for the overthrow.
Tossed up, on leg, Mushfiqur Rahim flicks it along the ground to short mid-wicket.
Slower through the air, a touch full, turning away, Mushfiqur Rahim pokes at it off the front foot as the ball hits his glove and goes into the off side.
Slower through the air and fuller, outside off, Najmul Hossain Shanto puts his front foot across and paddle sweeps this fine, to the left of short fine leg for a single.
Shorter and slower, on the pads, Mushfiqur Rahim dabs it down on the leg side.
Short and a bit of extra bounce, on leg, Mushfiqur Rahim watchfully defends.
FOUR! Punished! Too short, asking to be hit, Mushfiqur Rahim goes on the back foot quickly and slaps it past cover for another boundary.
Tosses it up, full and on middle, Mushfiqur Rahim clips it to mid-wicket.
FOUR! Bangladesh are into the lead! Short and outside off, Mushfiqur Rahim presses back, makes room and cuts it between cover and point for a boundary. The hosts lead by 1 run!
Tosses it up, full and on off, Mushfiqur Rahim reaches out in front and plays the lap towards deep fine leg for a couple of runs.
Fuller and attacking the front pad, Najmul Hossain Shanto blocks it out with a straight bat.
On a shortish length under the right shoulder of the batter, Najmul Hossain Shanto gets inside the line and leaves the ball alone.
In the channel on off, on a back of a length, left alone by Shanto.
Short and wide on off, slapped to point.

Has Shanto been strangled down leg? Zimbabwe think so but the umpire thinks otherwise. Craig Ervine has a word with the keeper and takes the review. On a short of a length, around leg, Najmul Hossain Shanto swivels for the pull but he is a bit early on the pull and misses. The UltraEdge shows no bat and the ball actually brushed the waist on the way to the keeper. Zimbabwe lose a review.
Pitched up, on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto clips it to mid-wicket.
Fuller and around off, Najmul Hossain Shanto pushes it wide of cover for a single.
Full and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto defends it solidly.

SIX! All the way! Loopy delivery, full and around off, Najmul Hossain Shanto winds up and goes downtown. Does not quite get it from the middle of the bat but gets enough to clear the long off fence. Bangladesh trail by 6 runs!
FOUR! Delightful shot! Floated up, full and on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto gets on the front foot and lofts it with a straight bat back over the bowler's head for a boundary.
Very full, on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto jams it out.
Flat and short, kept out off the back foot.
Dug in short, over off, Mushfiqur Rahim ducks under it.

A loud shout for LBW but turned down! Pitched up, on middle and leg, Najmul Hossain Shanto is late on the flick and gets beaten on the inside edge. A leg bye is taken as the ball goes off the front pad to deep third. Zimbabwe think about the review but decide against it. Seemed to be going down leg.
On off, on a short of a length, Najmul Hossain Shanto hops and defends.
On a good length, on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto hangs back to block.
Straying onto the pads, on a short of a length, Mushfiqur Rahim glances it to deep fine leg for one.
Lands it on a good length, on the off stump, Mushfiqur Rahim covers the line and keeps it out.
Full and attacking the stumps, Najmul Hossain Shanto strides ahead and dabs it down.
Darted in, full and on the off stump, Najmul Hossain Shanto defends it out.
Fuller and slower, outside off, Najmul Hossain Shanto smothers the spin off the front foot.

Floated up, fuller and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto lunges to keep it out.
Short and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto pushes it back to the bowler.
FOUR LEG BYES! Too straight, slanting into the pads, Mushfiqur Rahim misses the tickle. The ball goes off the pads and runs away for a boundary.
Honing in on the stumps, on a length, Mushfiqur Rahim pats it down the deck.
Around off, on a nagging length, Mushfiqur Rahim steers it to backward point.
Slanting in, on a good length, on middle, Mushfiqur Rahim blocks it out solidly.
Pitched up, seaming back in, on off, Mushfiqur Rahim pushes it to mid on.
On a back of a length, on off, Mushfiqur Rahim hangs back to defend.
Floated up, fuller and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto blocks it out off the front foot. That will be TEA on Day 2!
Short and wide on off, slapped straight to cover-point.
Full again, on middle, Mushfiqur Rahim clips it past mid-wicket for a single.
Full again, on off, Mushfiqur Rahim gets down the track and pushes it to mid-wicket.
Continues to toss it up, full and on off, Mushfiqur Rahim steps out and smothers the spin.
SIX! Belted! Loopy delivery, right in the slot, on middle, Mushfiqur Rahim clears his front leg and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket for a six.
Keeps it full again, on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto gets his bat out in front to defend.
Looped up, fuller and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto defends it into the off side.
Short and on leg, pushed to mid-wicket off the back foot.
Tosses it up, full and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto blocks it out with a lunge.
Short and on the pads, Najmul Hossain Shanto helps it past backward square leg for a couple of runs.
Full and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto pushes it back to the bowler.
Fuller in length, on middle, Mushfiqur Rahim clips it to mid-wicket.
Short and turning into the pads, Mushfiqur Rahim glances it down to deep fine leg for a couple of runs.
No run.
Pushed through, fuller and on off, Mushfiqur Rahim blocks it out solidly.
Short and on off, Mushfiqur Rahim hangs back to defend.

OUT! LBW! One brings two for Zimbabwe and Bangladesh have lost both set batters in 2 balls. Sliding on with the arm, full and on middle from around the wicket, Shadman Islam plants his front foot ahead and expects the ball to turn away. Tries to clip it against the turn with a closed bat face but the ball does not turn and goes on with the arm. Ends up playing inside the line of the ball and it sneaks past the inside edge to catch him on the front pad. A loud shout and the finger is raised. Shadman has a word with the skipper at the other end but decides to keep walking. A fine knock from Shadman comes to an end as he goes for 120 (181). Mushfiqur Rahim is the new batter.
Shadman Islam lbw B Bennett 120 (181b 16x4 1x6)

OUT! IN THE AIR AND GONE! Wellington Masakadza breaks through for Zimbabwe! Mominul Haque has fallen for the trap and he will be livid with himself. Masakadza tosses it up from over the wicket and lures the batter into the big shot. Full and on off, Haque cannot resist himself and gets down on a knee for the slog sweep despite there being a deep mid-wicket in place. Gets a top edge and the ball gets skied towards Ben Curran at deep mid-wicket. Curran runs in and slides ahead to take a reverse cup catch. Mominul falls for 33 (64). Bangladesh are now 194/2, trailing by 33 runs.
Mominul Haque c B Curran b W Masakadza 33 (64b 2x4 1x6)
More loop on this one, full and on middle, Mominul Haque clips it to mid-wicket.
Fuller and on middle, Mominul Haque lunges to defend.
Slanting in at the pads, Shadman Islam works it wide of backward square leg for a single.
Fuller and on off, Shadman Islam firms the drive straight to cover.
Short and around leg, turned away to square leg.
Very full, on off, Mominul Haque squeezes it out on the off side.

Short and on off, Mominul Haque pushes it to short cover.

On the pads, Mominul Haque turns this in front of backward square leg for a single.
Flat and short, on off, Mominul Haque dabs it to point.

Had the throw hit, Mominul Haque was gone! Short and on off, Mominul knocks it to the right of cover and sets off for the run. The fielder has a shy at the bowling end but misses. Haque was miles out.
Full and on leg, clipped to mid-wicket by Mominul Haque.

On off, on the shorter side, stabbed down.

On off, on a length, Mominul Haque covers the line and keeps it out.

On off, on a nagging length, Mominul Haque plays it back to the bowler.

Beaten! Full and this keeps straight, on off, Shadman Islam defends inside the line and gets beaten on the outside edge.

Short and turning into the pads, Shadman Islam flicks it to deep mid-wicket for one.

Almost dragged it back onto the stumps! On a nagging length, outside off, Shadman Islam goes hard on the drive and plays it away from his body. Gets an inside edge that sneaks past the stumps and rolls to the right of the keeper for one.
Sliding on with the arm, short and on middle, jabbed to mid-wicket.
On off, on a nagging length, Shadman Islam pushes it to cover.
SIX! Put away with disdain! A half-tracker, on middle, Shadman Islam has all the time in the world to rock back and unleash the pull over mid-wicket for a biggie.

SIX! Good use of the feet! Wellington Masakadza offers flight, fuller and on middle, Mominul Haque skips down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and launches it back over the bowler's head for a six. Bangladesh trail by 53 runs.
At the stumps, on a nagging length, pushed back to the bowler.
Short and on the pads, Mominul Haque keeps it out on the leg side.

Excellent effort in the field! Too short, on middle, Shadman Islam pulls it firmly towards deep mid-wicket where Ben Curran flings himself to his left and cuts it off with a dive. Prevents the boundary and keeps the batters down to one.
Fuller and slower, on off, Shadman Islam pats it to cover.

From wide of the crease on the around-the-wicket angle, full and on off, Mominul Haque blocks it out.

Pushed through, at the stumps, Mominul Haque gets back and pushes it to mid on.
FOUR! Up and over! A half-tracker from around the wicket, on off, Mominul Haque goes deep in the crease and pulls it over mid-wicket for a boundary.

Floats it up, full and on middle, Shadman Islam lunges and defends.

Full and on off, kept out off the front foot.

Fuller and on middle Shadman Islam eases it to mid on.
On a good length, on middle, Shadman Islam gets behind the line and pats it down.

On a good length, on off, Mominul Haque pushes it to mid off.
Short and on off, punched to cover.
Leg bye! Full and sliding down leg, Mominul Haque misses the sweep and a leg bye is taken as the ball goes off the pads towards backward square leg.

Quicker and flatter, outside off, Shadman Islam pushes it off the back foot to the left of short cover for a single.

OUT! LBW! Blessing Muzarabani has been rewarded for his good bowling! A touch full delivery, angled in and then straightened a bit after pitching. Anamul Haque looks to defend it as the ball beats his outside edge and hits the back leg. His feet didn’t move one bit. A loud appeal follows and the umpire raises his finger. The two batters converge and decide to go for the review. Here's the third umpire on screen. Nothing on UltraEdge. Here's the Ball Tracking. Pitching outside off, impact umpire's call and wickets hitting. Anamul Haque has to go. Bangladesh lose their first, trailing by 109 runs.
Anamul Haque lbw B Muzarabani 39 (80b 4x4 0x6)
Length ball on off, Anamul Haque defends it into the off side.

Length ball on middle, Shadman Islam pulls it along the ground to deep fine leg for a single.

Length ball, this time a touch closer to the off stump, Anamul Haque watches it carefully and leaves it alone.

Floated up, around off, Shadman Islam firms the drive straight to extra cover.

Full and on off, this does not turn and keeps straight, Anamul Haque closes the bat face early and gets a soft leading edge towards point.
Drifting in from wide of the crease on the around-the-wicket angle, full and on off, Shadman Islam hangs his bat out in front to defend. Gets an outside edge that dribbles past first slip for one.
Leg bye! Short and on the pads, Anamul Haque misses the flick. A leg bye is taken as the ball goes off the pads towards square leg.
Short and on off, punched away to deep cover for a single by Shadman Islam.

FOUR! A freebie and Shadman Islam accepts it gleefully! A half-tracker, outside off. This keeps low but Shadman Islam manages to drag the pull through mid-wicket for a boundary.

FIFTY FOR SHADMAN! Missed out in both innings in Sylhet but he has started well here. Wessly starts with a flighted delivery, full and around off, Shadman Islam caresses the drive wide of cover for a single to get to his 6th Test fifty.

Short and on middle, worked away to mid-wicket.

A loud appeal for LBW but turned down! The ball seemed to be doing too much and could have gone down leg. No review taken by Zimbabwe. Tosses it up, on a nagging length, on middle, Shadman Islam gets a stride forward to block. Gets beaten by the turn on the inside edge and wears it on the front pad.

50 up for Bangladesh! Tailing in at the toes, Shadman Islam glances it down to deep fine leg for a single.

Flat and short, on off, Anamul Haque dabs it towards cover.
Speared in short and on middle, Anamul Haque hangs back to defend.
